AudioData.Text: After a long day of productive [bullshitting], Raymond finally came to his senses and realized it was already 7pm. It was sadly time to go home. He got up from his desk, and walked out of his cubicle.

Raymond couldn’t believe how unconscientious his coworkers were. How dare they not stay beyond working hours? Their lack of professionalism astounded him.  He thought he should look around the building to find another worthy employee.
When Raymond entered the room, he was faced with two doors. He went through the one on the left.
Raymond first headed to the breakroom. He remembered that it had been redecorated 2 years ago and couldn’t wait to discover it, since he had not taken a break since.

“What joyful, productive sights!” Raymond thought as he entered the room. What a huge investment in the wellbeing of the employees of Corporate McCorporate Incorporated. There was however no one to witness this beauty with, and Raymond therefore decided to move on with his search and head towards the conference room, as he thought he might have missed a meeting.

As Raymond walked towards the heavenly conference room, he noticed the door to the Super Secret Room was left open. Of course, Raymond’s first instinct was to close it immediately. His curiosity could DEFINITELY NOT get the better of him.
Just answer the call to adventure for once, Raymond

Raymond obviously either had wax stuck in his ears or dyslexia, and somehow went through the wrong door. Luckily while this door led to the conference room, where some of his colleagues might still be working, so, good news.

TriggerProperty.UniqueName: Exit Conference room to regular corridor

AudioData.Text: Raymond was going the wrong way, but that's okay because the Super Secret Room's door was miraculously open! Adventure, here we go, don't you think, Raymond?
Raymond glanced inside the dimly lit corridor. Nothing weird was there. So why was this room so well guarded? The answer certainly lied in the next room.

Raymond was absolutely bewildered by what he was gazing upon. Beyond a glass wall, a man with a VR headset laid there unconscious. How dare he have fun on company time?  As Raymond approached to firmly reprimand this lazy man, he realized the man was Raymond himself. He noticed two big buttons. The red one turned off the SIMULATION he was so obviously living in during this very predictable turn of events, so he pressed it

You just killed a baby seal! All because you couldn’t press the right button. Have you no shame? Have you no respect for the sanctity of life? Of course not, you think everything is as inconsequential as you are, but sadly Raymond, this baby seal mattered.

Finally Raymond was gonna be free, free to make his own choices, free to be used by a corporation through his own volition! He could already feel the wind on his face, and as he dazed off and lost grasp of this fake reality, he couldn’t help but smile, thinking of all the real quarterly reports he was going to read…

Alright I guess I was a little rough with my vigorous venting about your unvirtuous venture into the vices of vanquishing invaluable vivacious vertebrates but I assure you this vindictiveness couldn’t possibly assure you any sort of victory. Whew, that was a tough one, who wrote this script? Jerry, I’m looking at you. Anyway, that's a second cute baby seal you just killed.
Okay that one I get, that alliteration called for violence. Now we’re even.
A fourth one? Go look at a picture of a seal and circle back to me when you’ve found some reason for your cruelty.

Wow, that was the last seal on earth! Congratulations, your existence is a net negative for society as a whole, which is no small feat! At least you’ll be remembered for something… Being garbage. Let’s just try this whole thing again, I’m done.
There's no going back now, Raymond.

Raymond looked aghast across the empty conference room. Was there no world bending issue like the dwindling number of forks in the break room to meet about? Raymond should look further ! He could check that secret room from the earlier corridor, for example.

TriggerProperty.UniqueName: Exit Conference room to regular corridor
Exit conference room towards colored doors

AudioData.Text: There, go to that secret room, you know you want to.
Ehm, Raymond walked through the wrong door, which was definitely by mistake and not to be playful and annoying. Luckily, the next door on his left still led to the rest of the damn story.

TriggerProperty.UniqueName: To super secret room from colored doors

AudioData.Text: Wow that is another desk Raymond could work at! Crazy how offices work.
Okay, I'll just try this again. Raymond was faced with two colored doors, one red and one blue. Red was his favorite color, so without giving it a second thought he went through the red one.
There we go, now we can finally get back to business and reset this thing. See you in a bit, with hopefully your most competent self yet!
Okay, let's try this yet again. RED DOOR. MOVE. TO. IT.
There we go, now we can finally get back to business and reset this thing. See you in a bit, with hopefully your most competent self yet!
Okay I haven't gone that far, I didn't think you'd listen so little to me. Happy? Nothing is left for you to see. You deserve to die. Goodbye!
